titles.title: We Give Thee But Thine Own

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: We give Thee but Thine own, Whate’er the gift may be: All that we have is Thine alone, A trust, O Lord, from Thee.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: May we Thy bounties thus As stewards true receive, And gladly, as Thou blessest us, To Thee our first fruits give.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: To comfort and to bless, To find a balm for woe, To tend the lone and fatherless, Is angels’ work below.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: The captive to release, To God the lost to bring, To teach the way of life and peace—- It is a Christ-like thing.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: And we believe Thy word, Though dim our faith may be: Whate’er for Thine we do, O Lord, We do it unto Thee. Amen.
